attributes.action: Hold local elections as planned and protect our democratic rights.
attributes.additional_details: A delay in scheduled elections undermines democratic principles and citizens' right to choose representatives. Leaders who can postpone elections may abuse this power when facing opposition or declining popularity. Electoral delays damage public trust and lead to civic disengagement. History shows such delays often precede democratic backsliding. While emergencies may require adjusting voting methods, the fundamental right to vote at scheduled intervals must be protected.
attributes.background: The unwritten nature of Britain's constitution places special responsibility upon Parliament to protect our democratic foundations. This petition urges Parliament to debate the critical issue of electoral timing to ensure our democratic institutions remain robust and protected from manipulation.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/710155
